thread.title: Cumberbatch's 'Hamlet' coming to local theaters for one day only
thread.title_full: Cumberbatch's 'Hamlet' coming to local theaters for one day only | Las Vegas Review-Journal

author: Christopher Lawrence
title: Cumberbatch's 'Hamlet' coming to local theaters for one day only
text:
Ladies, if you weren’t lucky enough to get tickets before they sold out more than a year ago, or you don’t want to mortgage your house to buy them from scalpers, you can still see your beloved Benedict Cumberbatch in the London production of “Hamlet.” 
And you can save yourself the airfare as well. 
The acclaimed performance is being filmed in London’s Barbican theater for broadcast in local movie theaters. 
You can see it at 7 p.m. Oct. 15 at the Colonnade, Orleans, Sam’s Town, Santa Fe, South Point and Village Square. 
Tickets are $18-$20. 
You won’t be at the Barbican in person to breathe in his Cumberbatchiness, but it’s better than nothing. 
Zedd plays not-so-secret...
